context: After the watershed events of <b4_0>Hurricane Andrew<b4_0/> in 1992, <a0_0>the state of Florida began <b5_0>investing in economic development<b5_0/> through the Office of Trade<a0_0/>, Tourism, and Economic Development. Governor Jeb Bush realized <a1_0>that <b6_0>watershed events such as Andrew negatively impacted Florida's backbone industry of tourism severely<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The office was directed to target <a2_0>Medical/Bio-Sciences<a2_0/> among others. Three years later, <a3_0>The <b7_0>Scripps Research Institute<b7_0/> (TSRI) announced it had chosen Florida for its newest expansion<a3_0/>. In 2003, <b8_0>TSRI<b8_0/> announced plans to establish a major science center in Palm Beach, a 364,000 square feet (33,800 m2) facility on 100 acres (40 ha), which TSRI planned to occupy in 2006.
